page.title: 12MEMORIES OF AYLMERTON
page.content: One villager interviewed was born in the village on 21 March, 1901, and has lived in the village all his life. His wife is 83 years old, and they have been married for 63 years. He was a{farmworker}most of his working life, with 37 years on one farm. When he started work, at the age of 13, he worked from 6a.m. on Monday to 6.30p.m. on Saturday. There were{no {holidays}- except for Christmas Day and half a day on Good Friday (but only if he went to church on Good Friday afternoon). On finishing work at 6.30p.m. on a Saturday, he would dress up and walk or cycle to the pictures in Cromer (no bus service). He remembers about 40 men being employed on farms in the parish, some of whom came from outside the village. Now, there are less than 12, as farms have become more mechanised.
